thread.title: Fubon LPGA tournament to tee off starting Oct. 22
thread.title_full: Fubon LPGA tournament to tee off starting Oct. 22

title: Fubon LPGA tournament to tee off starting Oct. 22
text:
Fubon LPGA tournament to tee off starting Oct. 22 CNAOctober 19, 2015, 12:00 am TWN SHARE Tweet TAIPEI -- The Fubon LPGA Taiwan Championship, the Taiwan leg of the LPGA tour, is scheduled to take place Oct. 22-25 in New Taipei, with seven of the world's top 10 players competing. 
Lydia Ko of New Zealand, who is second in the Rolex Rankings, American Stacy Lewis (third), and South Korean Ryu So-Yeon (fourth) will be among the 81 players vying for the US$2 million total cash prize at the Miramar Golf and Country Club in Linkou District. 
China's Feng Shanshan (sixth), and South Korea's Kim Hyo-Joo (seventh), Amy Yang (ninth), and Kim Sei-Young (10th) will also be competing. 
The 81 golfers comprise 62 LPGA athletes, 15 players from the Taiwan Professional Golf Association, and four recommended by the Fubon tournament sponsors. SHARE
